gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: mcb_soft_calibration

Explanation: This module implements a soft calibration process for a memory controller block (MCB). It performs several calibration steps including:

1. Input termination calibration for RZQ and ZIO pins
2. Broadcast of termination values to all I/O pins
3. Dynamic calibration of DQS (data strobe) signals

The module uses a state machine to control the calibration process, adjusting various parameters like P-term and N-term values, and DQS delays. It interfaces with IODRP (I/O Device, Reconfigurable Port) controllers to read and write calibration values. The calibration aims to optimize signal integrity and timing for the memory interface, adapting to variations in operating conditions. The module also handles self-refresh requests and implements a reset sequence for the MCB.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports:
UI_CLK, RST, PLL_LOCK, SELFREFRESH_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE, RZQ_IN, RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IN, ZIO_IODRP_SDO, MCB_UOSDO, MCB_UODONECAL, MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG, MCB_UODATA, MCB_UODATAVALID, MCB_UOCMDREADY, MCB_UO_CAL_START

Explanation:
UI_CLK: User interface clock
RST: Reset signal
PLL_LOCK: PLL lock signal
SELFREFRESH_REQ: Self-refresh request signal
SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE: MCB self-refresh mode signal
RZQ_IN, ZIO_IN: Input signals for RZQ and ZIO pins
RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IODRP_SDO: IODRP serial data output for RZQ and ZIO
MCB_UOSDO: MCB user output serial data
MCB_UODONECAL: MCB calibration done signal
MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG: MCB refresh flag
MCB_UODATA: MCB user output data
MCB_UODATAVALID: MCB data valid signal
MCB_UOCMDREADY: MCB command ready signal
MCB_UO_CAL_START: MCB calibration start signal

Output ports:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL, SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE, IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI, RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS, MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST, MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL, MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC, MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIREAD, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC, MCB_RECAL, MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT, MCB_SYSRST, Max_Value, CKE_Train

Explanation:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL: Soft and hard calibration done signal
SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE: Self-refresh control signals
IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI: IODRP address and serial data input
RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS: IODRP chip select for RZQ and ZIO
MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIBROADCAST: MCB user interface signals
MCB_UIDRPUPDATE: MCB IODRP update signal
MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL: MCB control signals
MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC: DQ calibration control signals
MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC: DQS calibration control signals
MCB_UIREAD, MCB_RECAL: MCB read and recalibration signals
MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT: MCB command and DQ count signals
MCB_SYSRST: MCB system reset signal
Max_Value: Maximum calibration value
CKE_Train: CKE training signal

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals:
STATE, P_Term, N_Term, P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w, P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev, IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR, IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA, Active_IODRP, IODRPCTRLR_R_WB, IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_CMD_VALID, MCB_USE_BKST, Pre_SYSRST, IODRP_SDO, Max_Value_Previous, count, counter_en, First_Dyn_Cal_Done, DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY, counter_inc, counter_dec, RST_reg, Block_Reset, MCB_UODATAVALID_U, LastPass_DynCal, First_In_Term_Done.

Explanation:
STATE: Current state of the calibration state machine
P_Term, N_Term: Positive and negative termination values
P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w: Skewed termination values for different I/O types
P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev: Previous termination values
IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR: IODRP memory cell address
IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA: Data to be written to IODRP
Active_IODRP: Currently active IODRP (RZQ, ZIO, or MCB)
IODRPCTRLR_R_WB: IODRP read/write control
IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, MCB_CMD_VALID: Command valid signals for IODRP and MCB
IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_USE_BKST: Broadcast mode control for IODRP and MCB
Pre_SYSRST: Internal reset signal
IODRP_SDO: IODRP serial data output
Max_Value_Previous: Previous maximum calibration value
count, counter_en: Counter for timing control
First_Dyn_Cal_Done: Flag for first dynamic calibration completion
DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY: DQS delay values
counter_inc, counter_dec: Counters for increment and decrement operations
RST_reg: Registered reset signal
Block_Reset: Signal to block reset during certain operations
MCB_UODATAVALID_U: Registered MCB data valid signal
LastPass_DynCal: Flag to track the last calibration pass type
First_In_Term_Done: Flag to indicate completion of first input termination calibration
